text: Marcelo Luiz Rezende Fernandes (November 12, 1951 â€“ September 16, 2017) was a Brazilian journalist and television presenter. He was born in Rio de Janeiro. He began his career as a sports journalist in Rio de Janeiro in the coverage of several major games in the 1970s. Rezende worked at Rede Globo for 23 years as a reporter, where he was hired to present the Linha Direta police program until December 2000. The last program he worked in was called Cidade Alerta (Alert City) and was presented on RecordTV. Rezende died of multiple organ failure complicated by pancreatic cancer in Rio de Janeiro on September 16, 2017 at the age of 65. ==References== ==Other websites== Category:1951 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Brazilian journalists Category:Brazilian television presenters Category:Writers from Rio de Janeiro
